result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: any other sentence.
*6/14/2016  Credit amended to three (3) days.

miscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision.   Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  All applicable fees of supervision.

Defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation (probation only to run concurrent with case# 14CF3771).

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No cash bail on deposit.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing Referral Form
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Sentencing hearing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and of maximum penalties, waived all rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by state and defense to complaint as factual basis to sustain plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Court ordered Jury Trial date converted to Sentencing Hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.

Defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.  
Court ordered charge amended to Bail Jumping, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 946.49(1)(2), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests status to follow the final pre-trial and jury trial in case# 14CF3771.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Antoni Apollo for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Sherri Ann Lorimer in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
